name: Grandma's Swedish Meatballs
author: Julie Martinez
summary: This is my grandmother's recipe for meatballs. It's very quick and easy, and they come out very tasty. They can be served with spaghetti, or as meatball subs, or any way you'd like to serve meatballs.
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Mix ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, onion, black pepper, nutmeg, and salt together in a bowl; form into small balls
Arrange balls on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
Flip meatballs and continue baking until cooked through, 12 to 15 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
